Posted By: Ghostmyth (9/26/2012 6:06:13 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think it's a decent card for Limited due to its ability to mitigate double strike damage, especially since those creatures tend to have low starting power. Also bear in mind that not many creatures can swing for 5 damage in this format, so it's a viable stalling tactic if you absolutely need one.  
  
Also, nice catch by Kryptnyt - this is indeed the [Staff of Zegon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staff of Zegon) effect!  
  
Obviously, in Constructed this is obviously not going to make many decks, since games are over faster and there is a much bigger field to play with.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This is a simic card. The reason it costs so much is that it's versatile!  
  
Make your own creature able to evolve with something weaker than the creature's current power, or mess with your opponent during a combat.  
  
Expensive? Yes. But simic has green for ramping so it shouldn't be that big of a deal.
